ptolemy.backtrack.eclipse.plugin.util

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.backtrack.eclipse.plugin.util.Environment

  • public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
    The class containing a set of static methods for the transformation environment.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 5.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Thomas Feng
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (tfeng)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (tfeng)

    • Method Detail

      • createFolders

        public static void createFolders(org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer container)
                          throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
        Create the folder represented by the container object, and all its parent folders if necessary.
        Parameters:
        container - The container representing the folder to be created.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - If the folder creation fails.

      • getAffectedFolder

        public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer getAffectedFolder()
        Get the folder where all the transformed classes are placed. It is a sub-folder rooted at the backtracking root (can be set in the preference page). The sub-path is appended to the root according to the backtracking prefix.
        Returns:
        The container representing the folder where all the transformed classes are placed.

      • getClassPaths

        public static java.lang.String[] getClassPaths(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Get the default class paths.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell object.
        Returns:
        The array of class paths, or null if Ptolemy is not found.

      • getContainer

        public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer getContainer(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath path)
        Given a path, return its container representation in Eclipse.
        Parameters:
        path - The path.
        Returns:
        The container, or null if the path is invalid.

      • getPtolemyHome

        public static java.lang.String getPtolemyHome()
        Get the Ptolemy home.
        Returns:
        The Ptolemy home, or null if Ptolemy is not found.

      • getPtolemyHome

        public static java.lang.String getPtolemyHome(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Get the Ptolemy home. If Ptolemy cannot be found, an error message is popped up in the given shell.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell.
        Returns:
        The Ptolemy home, or null if Ptolemy is not found.

      • getRefactoredFile

        public static org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath getRefactoredFile(java.lang.String source,
                                                               java.lang.String packageName)
        Given the source name of a Java file and its package name, return the path to the transformed file with backtracking prefix added to it.
        Parameters:
        source - The Java source file.
        packageName - The package name.
        Returns:
        The path to the transformed file.

      • getRefactoringRoot

        public static java.lang.String getRefactoringRoot()
        Get the root for the source transformer. This root can be set in the preference page.
        Returns:
        The root, or null if the root is invalid.

      • getRefactoringRoot

        public static java.lang.String getRefactoringRoot(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Get the root for the source transformer. This root can be set in the preference page. If the root is invalid, an error message is popped up in the given shell.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell.
        Returns:
        The root, or null if the root is invalid.

      • getSourceList

        public static java.lang.String getSourceList()
        Get the file name of the refactoring source list.
        Returns:
        The file name of the refactoring source list, or null if the source list is invalid.

      • getSourceList

        public static java.lang.String getSourceList(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Get the file name of the refactoring source list. If the source list is invalid, an error message is popped up in the given shell.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell.
        Returns:
        The file name of the refactoring source list.

      • setupTransformerArguments

        public static boolean setupTransformerArguments(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell,
                                                boolean config,
                                                boolean alwaysOverwrite)
        Set up the transformation arguments according to the preferences set in the preference page. Static fields of the transformer are initialized with these arguments.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell.
        config - Whether to generate MoML configuration.
        alwaysOverwrite - Whether to overwrite existing files.
        Returns:
        false if the Refactoring root cannot be found, true otherwise.
